page.title: 19TILMANSTONE PIT _ SURFACE
page.content: {Tilmanstone Pit}has been a part of Kent{landscape}and{economy}since 1913. The{pit_head}lies at a cross_roads; with the eastern arm bearing{pit traf_ {fic}to the A256. The scene is fairly typical of a working mine.{Winding {Gear}stands against the skyline, with {spoil heaps}to the north_west of the Pit.{Reservoirs}lie to the north. The water is sent underground to Deal. The Pit has a{screening}and{cleaning plant to grade the coal, most of which is used by the{steel industry.}The{Pit {site}houses a canteen, baths, lamp_ room, medical centre, offices, garage for an ambulance. The end of the{mining dispute}in 1985 saw a good number of voluntary {redundancies.}The future of the Col_ liery remained uncertain until July when the{proposed closure}in 1986 was announced.
